entries.title: Some day soon we might be making popcorn with infrared poppers
entries.description: It's fast, energy efficient, environmentally friendly compared to conventional heating

entries.title: New GeForce RTX 3050 variant offers the same performance but lower power use
entries.description: GA107 die has just the right number of CUDA cores for an RTX 3050.

entries.title: No more TikTok on House of Representatives’ smartphones
entries.description: Security issues make the app "high risk," according to House cybersecurity office.

entries.title: Musk contradicts Twitter safety chief, disavows statement as “fake news”
entries.description: It's still unclear which Twitter exec was telling the truth.

entries.description: The game's long, convoluted history gets longer and more convoluted.

entries.title: Military device with biometric database of 2K people sold on eBay for $68
entries.description: Researchers say DOD ignored attempts to flag the leak impacting 2,632 people.

entries.title: Old dog, new trick: Microsoft tests a tabbed UI for Notepad.exe in Windows 11
entries.description: Windows 1.0-era app picks up a hot new Windows XP-era feature.

entries.title: What are mud volcanoes?
entries.description: Mud volcanoes form when a combination of mud, fluids, and gases erupt at the Earth’s surface.

entries.title: Is it time for GDPR 2.0?
entries.description: EU rules preserve some privacy but can be better.

entries.title: 2022 in GPUs: The shortage ends, but higher prices seem here to stay
entries.description: Intel Arc joins the fray, and Nvidia charges big money for big performance.

entries.title: Twitter sells blue checks, Tumblr allows nudes: 2022’s biggest Big-Tech U-turns
entries.description: Gmail stops filtering political spam, Meta allows some death threats, and more.
